attributes.action: Introduce high minimum fines for drivers/motorcyclists caught without insurance
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Some people drive without insurance, knowing that the penalty if caught is often less than the annual premium they would pay if they chose to take out insurance.  

A published study suggests that the cost of uninsured drivers adds £30 to the cost of each premium for insured drivers.  Why should each honest insured driver fund those who choose to disregard the law?  

A high fine will increase the deterrant and provide the revenue for compensation/costs that the Motor Insurers Bureau currently require of our insurers.

Put simply, the deterrant needs to be strong enough that people are left with an economical alternative - to take out insurance.
